ed:term.ofx:paragraph: The system WGS 84 in decimal notation has to be used. The World Geodetic System (WGS) is a standard in cartography, geodesy and navigation. It comprises a standard coordinate system for the earth, a standard spheroidal reference surface (th datum or reference ellipsoid) for raw altitude data and a gravitational equipotential surface (the geoid) the defines the nominal sea level.
